member.name: P:Gravity.GoogleMaps.TimeZoneBuilder.Builders.TimeZoneBuilderOptions.DisableApiKeyCheck
member.value: When set to true, disables enforcement of the API key requirement.
member.remarks: Normally, the builder validates that an API key is provided before generating the final URL. Enable this option only when you explicitly need to bypass this validation, such as when generating a mock or placeholder URL for testing purposes.

member.name: P:Gravity.GoogleMaps.TimeZoneBuilder.Builders.TimeZoneBuilderOptions.ReturnParametersOnly
member.summary: Instructs the builder to return only the query parameters, without including the full base address (e.g. "center=Paris&zoom=10&size=1x1&key=YOUR_API_KEY").
member.remarks: This is useful when working with a preconfigured that already contains the Google Static Maps endpoint as its , or when composing the final URL externally. It ensures that the builder does not prepend the protocol and base path.

member.name: P:Gravity.GoogleMaps.TimeZoneBuilder.Builders.TimeZoneBuilderOptions.DisableUrlEncoding
member.value: When set to true, disables URL encoding of parameter values.
member.remarks: URL encoding is enabled by default and recommended in accordance with the official Google Maps encoding guidelines. Disabling encoding should be done with caution and only when you are certain that the values are already safely encoded or when constructing URLs for debugging.
